qas.question: What popular a capella competition is not specific to college groups?
Aside from the monetary reward, what was offered to the winner of The Sing-Off?

answers.text: a recording contract with Epic Records/Sony Music

qas.question: What is the name of the group that won The Sing-Off?
Who won The Sing-Off final season?
In The Sing-Off, where did the groups not from the United States come from?
When did the  A Cappella Recording Awards air on NBC?

plausible_answers.text: $100,000 and a recording contract with Epic Records/Sony Music

qas.question: What prize did Ben Folds win on The Sing-Off tv competition series?
What show was judged by Harmony Sweepstakes?
How many groups were competing for the prize from the Contemporary A Cappella Recording Awards?
Who won the Contemporary A Cappella Society final season?

context: Increased interest in modern a cappella (particularly collegiate a cappella) can be seen in the growth of awards such as the Contemporary A Cappella Recording Awards (overseen by the Contemporary A Cappella Society) and competitions such as the International Championship of Collegiate A Cappella for college groups and the <a0_0>Harmony Sweepstakes<a0_0/> for all groups. In <b5_0>December 2009<b5_0/>, a new television competition series called <b7_0>The Sing-Off<b7_0/> aired on NBC. The show featured <b8_0>eight<b8_0/> a cappella groups from the United States and <a4_0>Puerto Rico<a4_0/> vying for the prize of <b6_0>$100,000 and <a1_0>a recording contract with Epic Records/Sony Music<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The show was judged by Ben Folds, Shawn Stockman, and Nicole Scherzinger and was won by an all-male group from Puerto Rico called <a2_0>Nota<a2_0/>. The show returned for a second and third season, won by Committed and <a3_0><b9_0>Pentatonix<b9_0/><a3_0/>, respectively.
